message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.PF 

Reasoning: 
- cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) is the most likely category as the paper focuses on the problem of coflow scheduling in data centers, which involves network routing and bandwidth allocation. 
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) is also a likely category as the paper discusses distributed computing frameworks like MapReduce, Spark, and Dyrad. 
- cs.SY (Systems and Control) is a possible category as the paper formulates the coflow scheduling problem as a Mixed Integer Non-linear Programming problem and presents its relaxed convex optimization problem. 
- cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) is a possible category as the paper proposes two algorithms, CoRBA and CoRBA-fast, for jointly performing routing and bandwidth allocation for a given coflow while minimizing the CCT. 
- cs.PF (Performance) is a possible category as the paper aims to improve the execution performance of a job by reducing the completion time of a coflow, which can contribute more than 50% of the job completion time.
